Video games are going to be the literature of the 21st century. Great stories, characters, universes and ideas presented in the video games will shape our culture. Even so we have a rapidly expanding audience and budgets, there is still a long way to go there.


Regardless of the platform a video game is presented, the medium is incredibly strong. Unlike other form of arts, the audience in control. This creates enormous amount of new experiences. Rather than being a ghost who is following the hero during the journey, the players can be the hero, go through the challenges and fulfil the journey themselves.


The heroâ€™s journey is not about fighting, running, chasing, exploring, creating or destroying. It is all about development. When the journey is fulfilled, the hero is changed and grown. If the player is the hero of the game, then by the end of it, the player should be developed as well. Otherwisethe interaction with the audience is just an illusion. Let it be just an insight about a specific topic or a life-changing inspiration that affects players perspective on life completely, or just some motivation to carry on, the audience must leave the game world with an elixir that is useful in their life.


In our games we are aiming to deliver the elixir to the player.
